page.title: 11ST.KEVERNE PARISH CHURCH
page.content: { ST.KEVERNE PARISH CHURCH The 60 foot tower of St Keverne Church dominates the square. It warns ships of the treacherous Manacle Rocks (one mile off shore). In 1770 the spire was destroyed by lightning but it was quickly rebuilt because of its navigational importance. In the church yard graves are not only of villagers but of people drowned on the Manacles. There is a window in memory of the 'Mohegan', which was wrecked in 1898 with much loss of life and a bell in memory of a man's family who drowned. There is a mass grave on the north side of the church with a Celtic Cross. The church has 8 bells. On the north wall is a huge 13th Century mural of St. Christopher. It has been a place of Christian worship since 600 AD though the present church is mostly of 15th century origin.
